name: Au Revoir, Chris Hemsworth
description: Au Revoir, Chris Hemsworth is a short starring Pom Klementieff, Tom Cruise, and Rebecca Ferguson. Venice: A city full of beauty, love, music, and brutal trash talk. Join the Pom's team in saying "Au Revoir, Chris Hemsworth".

review.name: Top funny and highly addictive
review.reviewBody:
Fascinating, captivating, the funniest short of the type you will see. Pom -directed by Simon Pegg- sings like an angel and trash-talks like a... rude angel. The rhythm of images has a breakneck speed and every frame shine with fun, good taste and beauty.

The amazing rapid sequence of shots (more than 50 in 140 seconds) emulates the beating that Pom promises and the viewer himself feels like a punching bag until the last shot... the K.O.

 Pom excels in a comedy mood; she looks tender, posh, fierce, charming but always beautiful, funny and intelligent.

The original song ("Laisse tomber les filles") belongs to the genius of French Pop Serge Gainsbourg. The epic lyrics of the version sung in the short were written by Pom Klementieff and Simon Pegg.

Photography recreates the atmosphere of French New Wave films, although the short was made in Venice.

WARNING: It's highly addictive.
